TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant , who at about the same time took his doctor ’s degree in physics , joined ORG ( ORG ) and , when he obtained a post of senior academic teacher at ORG ( PERSON ) , attained the rank of lieutenant . During the entire period of his service the applicant worked as a teacher . He gave lectures on physics and carried out scientific research . Part of that research concerned issues considered important for national defence . He also published articles and scientific dissertations .
In DATE the applicant completed CARDINAL training courses : the first in fire prevention , the second designed for fire officers .
On an unspecified later date he achieved the rank of captain .

On DATE the applicant underwent a routine medical examination . The relevant report stated that he was permanently unfit to take part in fighting fires and emergency actions but fit to serve if he continued to work as a lecturer .

On DATE ORG opened disciplinary proceedings against the applicant on charges of insubordination ( in connection with his failure to comply with a superior ’s order ) , wilful disregard of instructions ( in that he had allowed third persons to have access to research carried out in respect of the matter of crucial importance for national defence ) and CARDINAL other breaches of discipline .

On DATE the Superintendent issued an order disciplinarily discharging the applicant from the fire service “ with effect from DATE ” . The applicant appealed to the Commandant of ORG ( ORG Państwowej PERSON ) .

On DATE the Commandant upheld the order . The applicant appealed to the Minister of the ORG ( Minister PERSON ) on DATE . He requested the Minister , inter alia , to “ quash immediately the relevant orders ” and to “ promote him and award a special prize as reward for his achievements ” .
On DATE the Minister upheld the decision to discharge the applicant from the fire service but amended the date on which it was to take effect , ordering that the material date be CARDINAL DATE .

Subsequently , on an unspecified date , the applicant appealed to ORG ( PERSON ) . He contested the decision of the Commandant of ORG of DATE and the decision of the Minister of the ORG of CARDINAL DATE , alleging that they were contrary to the law .

ORG gave judgment on DATE . It dismissed the appeal for CARDINAL principal reasons : firstly , because it had no jurisdiction to deal with disciplinary matters and , secondly , as it had found no legal flaw in the impugned decisions .

In the meantime , on an unspecified date , the applicant had sued ORG in ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy - Wydział Pracy ) , seeking reinstatement to the fire service . The court refused to deal with the merits of the claim because a discharge from the fire service did not fall within the labour courts’ jurisdiction , such matters being resolved exclusively in administrative proceedings .

The organisation of ORG , terms and conditions of service therein and detailed duties of firemen are laid down in the PERSON of DATE on ORG ( Ustawa o Państwowej PERSON ) ( as amended ) , hereafter referred to as “ the DATE LAW .

ORG in GPE is part of the national public service . From the organisational point of view , it is , like the police , incorporated into ORG . The Commandant of ORG is a public authority called a “ central organ of governmental administration ” ( centralny organ administracji rządowej ) and , like the Commandant of the Police , is subordinate to the Minister of the ORG ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act ) . The Minister of the ORG not only supervises ORG but also has the power to issue ordinances or other regulations setting out the detailed organisation of fire - fighting brigades , units and their equipment ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act ) .
Within the general structure of the ORG , ORG , like other emergency services , belongs to the forces for maintenance of public safety .
Section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act lays down the general tasks and duties of ORG . This provision reads :
“ CARDINAL . There shall be established ORG – a professional , uniformed and specially equipped formation , which shall deal with fire - fighting , disasters and other local emergencies .
CARDINAL . ORG shall carry out the following principal tasks :
CARDINAL ) identifying fire hazards and other local emergencies ;
CARDINAL ) organising and carrying out rescue actions during fires , disasters or operations to combat local emergencies ;
CARDINAL ) carrying out supporting specialised rescue actions during disasters or operations by other emergency services to combat local emergencies ;
CARDINAL ) training staff for ORG and other organs of fire protection and the national system for the protection of the nation ;
CARDINAL ) supervising compliance with fire - safety regulations ;
CARDINAL ) carrying out research into fire prevention and protection of the nation .
CARDINAL . Service in ORG shall be performed by fire service officials , hereafter named “ firemen ” . ”
Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL states :
“ ORG shall organise the national system of fighting fires and combating emergencies , aimed at protecting life , health , property and the environment , in particular through :
CARDINAL ) fighting fires and other disasters ;
CARDINAL ) technical rescue operations ;
CARDINAL ) chemical rescue operations ;
CARDINAL ) ecological rescue operations ;
CARDINAL ) medical rescue operations . ”
